name: The name of the package.
version: The version number of the package.
description: A short description of the package.
keywords: An array of keywords for package search optimization.
homepage: The URL to the package's homepage.
license: The license type under which the package is distributed.
author: The name or information about the package author.
contributors: A list of contributors to the package.

repository.type: The type of version control system used (e.g., git).
repository.url: The URL to the source code repository.

bugs.url: The URL where users can report issues.
bugs.email: The email address for reporting bugs.

GitHub URLs: URLs linking to relevant GitHub repositories or pages.
files: An array specifying which files or directories to include when publishing.
man: An array listing manual pages associated with the package.
main: The primary entry point file of the package.
browser: An alternative entry point optimized for browser environments.

Defines the entry points for module exports.

bin.command-name: Maps executable command names to their corresponding files.

scripts.start: Script command to start the application.

config.port: Configuration parameters for the package, e.g., server port.

dependencies: Packages required for the package to run properly.
peerDependencies: Packages that the consumer must install alongside this package.
peerDependenciesMeta: Metadata for peer dependencies, such as optional flags.
optionalDependencies: Dependencies that are optional and not critical.
bundleDependencies: Dependencies to be bundled within the package.
overrides: Overrides to force specific dependency versions.
URLs as Dependencies: Dependencies referenced via URLs to external package archives.
Git URLs as Dependencies: Dependencies pulled directly from git repositories.
Local Paths: Dependencies referenced via local filesystem paths.
engines: Specifies compatible Node.js or other runtime versions.
devEngines: Specifies engine versions required for development.
os: Operating systems supported by the package.
cpu: CPU architectures supported by the package.
libc: Supported C libraries or libc implementations.
private: Boolean indicating if the package is private and unpublished.
publishConfig: Configuration related to publishing, such as registry URLs.

funding.type: The type or source of funding for the package.
